    • Method Detail

      • createMission

        public void createMission(Map<String,Object> params,
                 ISirqulCallback<WrappedResponse<MissionResponse>> callback)
        Create a user defined mission.

        Target API Endpoint: /mission/create

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          The logged in user's account id.
        • SirqulKeys.title
          The title of the mission
        • SirqulKeys.startDate
          the date/time to start the mission
        • SirqulKeys.endDate
          the date/time to end the mission
        • SirqulKeys.active
          activate/deactivate the mission
        • SirqulKeys.gameLevelIds
          list of game level ids to include in the mission
        • SirqulKeys.audienceIds
          the audience ids
        • SirqulKeys.offerId
          the offer id to give as a reward
        • SirqulKeys.balance
          Set the amount of money available to spend, once 0 deactivate mission. Set to a negative value for unlimited.

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        error SirqulResponse, success a wrapped MissionResponse
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        MissionApiBase.createMission

      • findAds

        public void findAds(Map<String,Object> params,
           ISirqulCallback<WrappedResponse<List<MissionResponse>>> callback)
        Get a set of missions filtered by the parameters provided.

        Target API Endpoint: /ads/find

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.appKey of type String
          The application key, if provided return missions specific for the app. Will always return mission levels that are app agnostic.
        • SirqulKeys.suffix
          The type of mission to get.
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          The logged in user.
        • SirqulKeys.appVersion of type AppVersion
          The version of the application, will not return levels newer than the appVersion.
        • SirqulKeys.location of type Location
          The current location of the requesting device
        • SirqulKeys.device
          The name of the requesting device; possible values are:
          Android, iPhone, iPad, iPod, PC, OSX, WEBPLAYER
        • SirqulKeys.deviceVersion
          The requesting device version; examples are:
          2.3, 5.1.4, 6.1.4. Supports X, X.X, or X.X.X formated string.
        • SirqulKeys.start
          The index into the record set to start with.
        • SirqulKeys.limit
          The total number of record to return.
        • SirqulKeys.includeScores
          the include scores
        • SirqulKeys.includeGameData
          Include the game level data with the misison.
        • SirqulKeys.includeAudiences
          If true then return the audience data in the response. Default is false.
        • SirqulKeys.allocatesTickets
          If true/false only return missions whose game levels allocate (or don't allocate) tickets. Do not provide a value to return both.

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        a WrappedResponse<List<MissionResponse>> on success, SirqulResponse on failure.
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        MissionApiBase.findAds

      • findMissions

        public void findMissions(Map<String,Object> params,
                ISirqulCallback<WrappedResponse<List<MissionResponse>>> callback)
        Get a set of missions filtered by the parameters provided.

        Target API Endpoint: /mission/find

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.appKey of type String
          The application key, if provided return missions specific for the app. Will always return mission levels that are app agnostic.
        • SirqulKeys.suffix
          The type of mission to get.
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          The logged in user.
        • SirqulKeys.appVersion of type AppVersion
          The version of the application, will not return levels newer than the appVersion.
        • SirqulKeys.location of type Location
          The current location of the requesting device
        • SirqulKeys.device
          The name of the requesting device; possible values are:
          Android, iPhone, iPad, iPod, PC, OSX, WEBPLAYER
        • SirqulKeys.deviceVersion
          The requesting device version; examples are:
          2.3, 5.1.4, 6.1.4. Supports X, X.X, or X.X.X formated string.
        • SirqulKeys.start
          The index into the record set to start with.
        • SirqulKeys.limit
          The total number of record to return.
        • SirqulKeys.includeScores
          the include scores
        • SirqulKeys.includeGameData
          Include the game level data with the misison.
        • SirqulKeys.includeAudiences
          If true then return the audience data in the response. Default is false.
        • SirqulKeys.allocatesTickets
          If true/false only return missions whose game levels allocate (or don't allocate) tickets. Do not provide a value to return both.

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        a WrappedResponse<List<MissionResponse>> on success, SirqulResponse on failure.
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.

      • searchMissionFormats

        public void searchMissionFormats(Map<String,Object> params,
                        ISirqulCallback<SearchResponse<MissionFormatResponse>> callback)

        Searches on pre-defined mission formats.

        This information is used to generate the gameData parameter when creating a createGameLevel(Map, ISirqulCallback). A createMission(Map, ISirqulCallback) can then be created using the generated game level ID.

        Possbile Mission Formats by formatType:

        (All format types require a points field. This is a digit that represents the number of points the consumer will receive upon completion of the mission.)

        • PHOTO - {"type": "photo", "albumId": %d "points":%d} - Create an album and pass in the albumId.
        • VOTE - {"type": "vote", "ids": [%s], "points": %d} - Create an album contest and pass in the albumContestId for "ids". You can pass in multiple contests by separating the IDs with a comma.
        • ASK - {"type": "ask", "albumId": %d, "points": %d} - Create an album and pass in the albumId.
        • ANSWER - {"type": "answer", "albumId": %d, "points": %d} - Create an album and pass in the albumId.
        • AD - {"type":"click","action":"%s", points:%d} - Pass in a griply link for "action".
        • GAME - This does not require Json generation. An existing game level is used when creating a mission.
        • All other types don't require anything else other than points.


        Target API Endpoint: /mission/format/search

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.start
          The starting index in the result set to return. Default is 0.
        • SirqulKeys.limit
          The total number of records to return. Default is 20.
        • SirqulKeys.activeOnly
          Determines whether to return only active results. Default is false.

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        SearchResponse<MissionFormatResponse> on a valid response, SirqulResponse on an invalid response
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        MissionApiBase.searchMissionFormats

      • searchMissions

        public void searchMissions(Map<String,Object> params,
                  ISirqulCallback<WrappedResponse<MissionResponse>> callback)
        Get the list missions available to the account.

        Target API Endpoint: /mission/search

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          The logged in user.
        • SirqulKeys.start
          The index into the record set to start with. Default is 0.
        • SirqulKeys.limit
          The total number of record to return. Default is 20.
        • SirqulKeys.includeGameData
          If true then return the game level data in the response. Default is false.
        • SirqulKeys.includeAudiences
          If true then return the audience data in the response. Default is false.
        • SirqulKeys.includeInactive
          If true then include inactive missions. Default is false.

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        error SirqulResponse, success a wrapped list of MissionResponse
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        MissionApiBase.searchMissions

      • searchMissionsByBillableEntity

        public void searchMissionsByBillableEntity(Map<String,Object> params,
                                  ISirqulCallback<WrappedResponse<MissionResponse>> callback)
        Use the accountId to determine the associated BillableEntity. From there get a list of all accounts associated as managers. Get the list missions owned by all associated managers.

        Target API Endpoint: /mission/searcharchByBillableEntity

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          The logged in user.
        • SirqulKeys.start
          The index into the record set to start with. Default is 0.
        • SirqulKeys.limit
          The total number of record to return. Default id 20.
        • SirqulKeys.includeGameData
          If true then return the game level data in the response. Default is false.
        • SirqulKeys.includeAudiences
          If true then return the audience data in the response. Default is false.
        • SirqulKeys.includeInactive
          If true then include inactive missions. Default is false.

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        error SirqulResponse, success a WrappedResponse< MissionResponse>
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        MissionApiBase.searchMissionsByBillableEntity

      • updateMission

        public void updateMission(Map<String,Object> params,
                 ISirqulCallback<WrappedResponse<MissionResponse>> callback)
        Update a mission.

        Target API Endpoint: /mission/update

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          The logged in user's account id
        • SirqulKeys.missionId
          The id of the mission to update
        • SirqulKeys.title
          The title of the mission
        • SirqulKeys.startDate
          the date/time to start the mission
        • SirqulKeys.endDate
          the date/time to end the mission
        • SirqulKeys.active
          Activate/deactivate the mission
        • SirqulKeys.gameLevelIds
          list of game level ids to include in the mission
        • SirqulKeys.audienceIds
          the audience ids
        • SirqulKeys.offerId
          the offer id to give as a reward
        • SirqulKeys.balance
          Replace the amount of money available to spend, once 0 deactivate mission. Set to a negative value for unlimited.

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        error SirqulResponse, success a wrapped MissionResponse
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
